blog.name: stevesnightmares
blog.title: "Awake, arise, or be forever fallen."
blog.description: “The question that sometimes drives me hazy: Am I or the others crazy?”

body:
The girl in the fireplace

This episode (s02e04) is really loved by almost everyone, and personally I really love it too, I love the concept and execution and there are some of my favourite lines and interactions of the show, however I think it’s pretty fucked up that the doctor decided to save Reinette and doom Micky and Rose. Of his own choice he decided that he wanted to save Reinette and let Micky and Rose die on that ship, because for all he knew he couldn’t go back. If I was Rose I would feel so betrayed by this, because the doctor decided to leave them and save someone with whom, if you think about it, didn’t have that much of a big connection, because yes, he saw in what’s in her head, but he talked with her twice when she was a child and barely talked with her once or twice when she was older, and he still choose her life over Micky’s and Rose’s. Because they were going to die on that ship, yes, there probably was food in the TARDIS she they wouldn’t have died of thirst or hunger but what about it? They couldn’t fly it and there was nothing on that ship, what would have they done? I absolutely hate this aspect of the episode, I can’t even put into words how much.

blog.name: ygrain-synaerasis
blog.title: L'Echappée Belle d' Ygraïn
blog.description:
" Elle voulait une vie d'aventures, une vie folle, une vie plus grande qu'elle.Et l'on disait tout autour d'elle : [Ygraïn] rêve". Timothée de Fombelle, Victoria rêve

Je ne sais pas dessiner, les artworks que vous verrez ici ne sont pas les miens. Mais vous trouverez toujours un lien vers une gallerie de leurs auteurs. Personnellement, je ne fais que des montages (wallpaper, digiscrap, bannière ...) à partir de captures d'écran (screencap).. Ce tumblr est ma gallerie de rêves éphémères, mon échappée belle où je viens me ressourcer, me changer les idées, trouver un support à mes rêveries grâce aux fabuleux arts de d'autres artistes. .
Pour me contacter, en cas de problème: ygrain@gmail.com

Sinon: mon blog de lecture est: https://les-lectures-d-ygrain.tumblr.com/

Adventure Time, Bee and Puppycat, Doki Doki Literature Club, Gaming, Gravity Falls, Hamilton, Hiveswap/Homestuck, Infinity Train, Little Witch Academia, Marvel, MLP: FiM, NITW, Overwatch, Pokemon, Rick and Morty, Splatoon, Steven Universe, SvtFoE, Undertale, Voltron and some other stuff.

summary:
I gotta say, the 10th Doctor's regeneration scene is one of those scenes I have huge mixed feelings about... in a good way.
One...
body:
I gotta say, the 10th Doctor’s regeneration scene is one of those scenes I have huge mixed feelings about… in a good way.

One one hand, I’m crying my eyes out because:

  • We’re losing my favorite Doctor, David Tennant.
  • The sheer amount of time and energy he spends just to delay his regeneration.
  • Him saying goodbye (kind of) to everyone who travelled with him.
  • The music containing the same choir we’ve been hearing since the beginning back with the 9th Doctor.
  • The TARDIS literally tearing itself apart around him (probably because it was so sad to see him regenerate).
  • “I don’t want to go.”

But then I go from heartbroken tears to a huge smile and chuckling because:

  • We get Matt Smith, another one of my favorite Doctors.
  • The 11th Doctor checking that he still has all his parts.
  • Complaining that he’s “still not ginger”.
  • Commenting on the size of his chin and the length of his hair.
  • Matt Smith’s fantastic acting and comedy.
  • “GERONIMO!!!”

tags: i feel like i need to apologize for tagging both in the same post
summary: Once this is all over and Hollywood inevitably makes a film about the whole mess I want David Tennant to play the role of...
body:
Once this is all over and Hollywood inevitably makes a film about the whole mess I want David Tennant to play the role of Stephen Miller. He might actually be able to find a shred of humanity in this prematurely aged, hollowed out shell of a child-sociopath with his rage-on for anyone and everything he ever felt inferior to even for a second, and his pathetic high school theatre version of authoritarianism, and his sad, sad spray-on hair. 

Obviously it would be way better than the real thing, but you know. What wouldn’t be.

reblog.comment:
